intro: Erysimum thalianum, commonly known as wall rocket, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of leaves that are pinnately lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are bright yellow and arranged in racemes, blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
